newsitem.title: USA: Kansas feedlot cattle market roundup - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Kansas feedlot cattle market roundup - USDA.

text.p: Trade was fairly active late Wednesday after very slow activity most of the day, USDA said. Slaughter steers and heifers $2.00 per cwt lower than last week. Inquiry good, demand light.

Sales confirmed on 4,800 slaughter steers and 3,500 slaughter heifers Wednesday. For the week to date 18,000 head confirmed, including 7,700 head or about 63 percent previously contracted or formulated cattle.
Sales FOB feedlot net weights after 4 percent shrink.
Slaughter steers - Select and Choice 2-3 1100-1300 lbs 71.00; Few Select with end Choice 2-3 1250-1300 lbs 71.00.
Slaughter heifers - Select and Choice 2-3 1050-1200 lbs, mostly 1050- 1075 lbs 71.00; Few Select with end Choice 2-3 980-1075 lbs 71.00, load 70.75.
Wk to date - 18,000 week ago - 56,400 year ago - 82,000
